channel.title: Judith F. Kribelbauer
channel.description: Recent content on Judith F. Kribelbauer

item.title: Course Title 2
item.description: This undergraduate course presents many new things.

item.title: Context transcription factors establish cooperative environments and mediate enhancer communication
item.description: Kribelbauer, J. F., Laptenko, O., Chen, S., Martini, G. D., Freed-Pastor, W. A., Prives, C., … & Bussemaker, H. J. (2017). Quantitative analysis of the DNA methylation sensitivity of transcription factor complexes. Cell reports, 19(11), 2383-2395.

item.title: Context-dependent gene regulation by homeodomain transcription factor complexes revealed by shape-readout deficient proteins
item.description: Kribelbauer, J. F., Loker, R. E., Feng, S., Rastogi, C., Abe, N., Rube, H. T., … & Mann, R. S. (2020). Context-dependent gene regulation by homeodomain transcription factor complexes revealed by shape-readout deficient proteins. Molecular cell, 78(1), 152-167.

item.title: Low-Affinity Binding Sites and the Transcription Factor Specificity Paradox in Eukaryotes
item.description: Kribelbauer, J. F., Rastogi, C., Bussemaker, H. J., & Mann, R. S. (2019). Low-affinity binding sites and the transcription factor specificity paradox in eukaryotes. Annual review of cell and developmental biology, 35, 357-379.
